description.narrative: 520 girls will be trained and at least 390 will be (self)employed in 6 months after the training. Income of 390 girls will be about 75% to 100% higher than before the training4.  Siblings/children of the employed girls will be able to go to school (if of school going age)  180 masters from 3 trades are enthused to take in apprentices and able to guide them.  the capacity of 1 organization has increased in order to run 2 different training centers and continue with the WBL and ready steady independently  here will be 1 Kenyan expert to promote WBL and give advice to organizations to start WBL  the financial sustainability of WBL, since it is low cost. Training can be continued for 477 euro per student (based on 240 students per year). Connections have been made with hospitality branch organizations to support the approach. In addition, resources come through income generating activities5 (for orphans and young mothers), scholar fees (other students), and small external donor funding. The option of working on a no-cure no pay bases, where graduates are refunded if they are not employed within 3 months after the end of the training will be examined during the project period.

participating-org.narrative: Ujima Foundation for Training and Development - UFTD

sector.narrative: Basic life skills for youth and adults

title.narrative: Trainers trained in Edukans methods (ATL, CSE, SEL, Life skills, GRP)

description.narrative: Trainers trained in Edukans methods (ATL, CSE, SEL, Life skills, GRP)

This indicator refers to the number of trainers that completed one or more Edukans training(s) on Active Teaching & Learning, Comprehensive Sexuality Education, Social & Emotional Learning, Lifeskills and/or Gender Responsive Pedagogy

comment.narrative: The project went well in the first two years surpassing the targeted numbers. In 2019 and 2020 however, the figures dropped. The final planned meeting was unable to take off because of the COVID-19 restrictions.

title.narrative: Young people demonstrate labour market relevant (life) skills and are able to find employment/to start own business

description.narrative: Young people demonstrate labour market relevant (life) skills and are able to find employment/to start own business

title.narrative: Young people demonstrate labour market relevant (life) skills and are able to find employment/to start own business

description.narrative: Students successfully completed TVET training and received a certificate of completion

comment.narrative: The project planned for 394 girls (75%) to be employed. There is a deficit of 93 girls that need to have accessed employment by December 2020. Many of the girls that had already been employed have since lost their jobs due to the COVID-19 Pandemic. However, the number of girls that directly got jobs/self emplyment through the project were 302 within the three years.

title.narrative: The extent to which youth demonstrate enhanced knowledge, skills and attitude on SRHR and/or SEL

description.narrative: Students successfully completed TVET training and received a certificate of completion

title.narrative: Young people have decent income through (self) employment

description.narrative: Young people have decent income through (self) employment

title.narrative: Number of young people with decent income through (self) employment

description.narrative: Edukans wants marginalised youth to get (self) employed in order to finally develop a sustainable livelihood. This is achieved through (technical) vocational training and Life skills training. The training helps youngsters to be professional in obtaining and keeping a job or start their own business

title.narrative: % of youth that completed vocational education

description.narrative: The percentage of youth that completed vocational education out of all youth that received vocational education in an Edukans project. This indicator is an indication for the quality of education. In addition, drop-out could be estimated using the completion rates.

title.narrative: Youth stating to be (self)employed 6 months after completing training

title.narrative: Number of youth stating to be (self)employed 6 months after completing training

description.narrative: Through receiving market relevant skills, youth are able to find employment/start their own business

title.narrative: Number of youth stating to have taken up further education 6 months after completing training

description.narrative: After receiving market relevant skills, youth are stimulated to take up further education

title.narrative: Youth trained in market relevant skills

description.narrative: Youth trained in market relevant skills
This indicator refers to the scope of Edukans' reach in the technical/vocational education field. All TVETs that are directly involved in projects of Edukans are measured by this number.

This indicator refers to the total number of youth directly trained through TVET programmes of Edukans and who completed the training or educational course (in order to get a general sense of the scope of Edukans' reach).

comment.narrative: By March 2020, there was a deficit of 92 girls that had not been reached. A low cost extention was granted that covered the deficit reaching a total of 532 girls for the entire project. The extention also enabled Ujima to put in place mechanism to efficiently operate the WBL in readiness over the project cycle. Most of the trains come from Mombasa where Ujima is implementing only one project-The Girls@work
